client_profile: A couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels, with a budget of 770,000–1,055,000 EUR. Priorities include restaurants, central access, and cafes & brunch.
red_flags: High property taxes in certain districts.
Expensive maintenance fees in older buildings.
Limited parking spaces in popular areas.
Noise from nightlife in busy districts.
Long commute times without good transit.
contradictions: Desire for central access vs. housing budget.
Preference for modern apartments vs. older character buildings.
Focus on cafes vs. need for quiet spaces.
Interest in nightlife vs. need for family-friendly areas.

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Ixelles features diverse dining options and trendy brunch spots.
Excellent public transport connections make commuting easy.
watch_out: Prepare for potential noise from bustling restaurants and cafes.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles
why: Saint-Gilles boasts a rich selection of eateries and dynamic nightlife.
Strong public transit accessibility supports easy travel throughout the city.
watch_out: Vibrant scenes can sometimes lead to increased noise levels.
